strategy: Replace the neural network with a Random Forest ensemble and introduce recursive feature elimination (RFE) to select the most predictive features based on out-of-bag (OOB) score. Apply target encoding with K-nearest neighbors (KNN) smoothing for categorical variables to reduce noise and improve generalization. Additionally, use Box-Cox transformation on all continuous features to normalize their distributions, which can enhance tree-based model stability and convergence. This approach leverages ensemble robustness and feature selection to improve performance without relying on deep non-linear models.

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import RFE
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler, KBinsDiscretizer
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']
X_test = test_df.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numeric columns with median
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
mode_values = X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0]
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_val[categorical_columns] = X_val[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)

# Apply Box-Cox transformation to normalize continuous features
# Box-Cox requires positive data, so add small constant
epsilon = 1e-8
for col in numeric_columns:
    X_train[col] = np.log(X_train[col] + epsilon)
    X_val[col] = np.log(X_val[col] + epsilon)
    X_test[col] = np.log(X_test[col] + epsilon)

# Target encoding with KNN smoothing for categ

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestRegressor
from sklearn.feature_selection import RFE
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']
X_val = validation_df.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation_df['SalePrice']

categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Fill missing values in numeric columns with median
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Fill missing values in categorical columns with mode
mode_values = X_train[categorical_columns].mode().iloc[0]
X_train[categorical_columns] = X_train[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_val[categorical_columns] = X_val[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)
X_test[categorical_columns] = X_test[categorical_columns].fillna(mode_values)

# Apply Box-Cox transformation to normalize continuous features
# Box-Cox requires positive data, so add small constant
epsilon = 1e-8
for col in numeric_columns:
    X_train[col] = np.log(X_train[col] + epsilon)
    X_val[col] = np.log(X_val[col] + epsilon)
    X_test[col] = np.log(X_test[col] + epsilon)
